abstracts.value: AGN are emitters of very-high energy cosmic rays (including gammas), powered by supermassive black holes. This thesis discusses the analysis and interpretation of multiwavelength observations of AGN by MAGIC, AGILE and by various X-rays and optical instruments. The relation between SSC parameters and the variability of sources is investigated. A novel method to measure the density of the extragalactic background light using simultaneous multiwavelength observations of AGN is discussed.

titles.title: MAGIC $\gamma$-ray observations of distant AGN and a study of source variability and the extragalactic background light using FERMI and air Cherenkov telescopes
